channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Aug 28
Punggol BTO project to be delayed after contractor fired
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

The building contractor for a Punggol Build-To-Order (BTO) project has been fired for failing to meet project milestones, the Housing Board (HDB) said yesterday.

item.title: New courses for those eyeing switch to built environment sector
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Mid-career workers can soon sign up for more than 10 new courses that will help prepare them to take up jobs in the built environment sector.

item.title: Addendum to President's Address: Underused road lanes could be turned into cycling or bus lanes, says Ong Ye Kung
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

With the coronavirus pandemic reducing traffic on the roads and changing commuting patterns, certain under-used road lanes can be converted to cycling and bus lanes, said Transport Minister Ong Ye Kung yesterday.

item.title: Man who lied in PR application fails in appeal against jail term
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

More than two decades ago, a Pakistani national applying to be a permanent resident here lied to the authorities that his highest academic qualification was an arts degree from the University of Punjab.

item.title: Job rules tightened so Singaporeans have more access to vacancies
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Rules regarding the hiring of foreigners are being tightened so that Singaporeans have greater access to the vacancies on offer.

item.title: Tributes pour in for law icon Harry Elias, who dies at age 83
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Local law giant Harry Elias, who was the founding chairman of the Law Society's Criminal Legal Aid Scheme (Clas) some 35 years ago, died on Wednesday.

item.title: NTUC task force to champion protection of local PMEs
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

A new task force to champion the protection of professionals, managers and executives (PMEs) is being set up by the labour movement, it announced yesterday.

item.title: High Court stresses duty to disclose witness statements
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

A High Court judge has reiterated that the prosecution has a duty to disclose witness statements to the defence, even when there is doubt about the relevance or impact of the material.

item.title: No obligation under Ceca to offer Indian nationals PR status: MTI
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

There is no provision under the India-Singapore Comprehensive Economic Cooperation Agreement (Ceca) for Indian nationals to become Singapore permanent residents and citizens, said the Ministry of Trade and Industry (MTI).

item.title: Teacher who took drugs sentenced to 9 months' jail
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

A Briton who had taught in Singapore for about 30 years was sentenced to nine months' jail yesterday after he pleaded guilty to consuming drugs.

item.title: Suntec Singapore lays off almost half of staff amid impact on Mice industry
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Nearly half of the employees of the Suntec Singapore Convention and Exhibition Centre (Suntec Singapore) have been retrenched amid the ongoing decimation of the meetings, incentives, conventions and exhibitions (Mice) industry.

item.title: Anti-scam drive urges healthy dose of scepticism amid surge in cases
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Scepticism and a wariness of deals that are too good to be true are the first line of defence against being scammed, said Mr Gerald Singham, chairman of the National Crime Prevention Council (NCPC).

item.title: 27 employees to be laid off at joint venture with Boeing
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Twenty-seven employees will be laid off in a retrenchment exercise at Boeing Asia Pacific Aviation Services (Bapas), a joint venture between The Boeing Company and SIA Engineering Company.

item.title: Man fined for assaulting actress-model over commotion involving others
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

A man pulled actress-model Melissa Faith Yeo Lay Hong's hair and punched her head in May last year after he saw her quarrelling with others at the void deck of a block of flats in Ang Mo Kio.

item.title: Rolls-Royce to focus on fan blades here, move some operations to UK
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

British jet engine-maker Rolls-Royce will manufacture its wide-chord fan blades entirely in Singapore and move some operations back to Britain, as part of the aerospace giant's consolidation plans amid the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: 80 disputes over mask rules on public transport since April
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

There have been around 80 cases of disputes involving commuters who did not mask up on public transport since April, said the Land Transport Authority (LTA) yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: A glimpse into global vaccine race
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

31 vaccines are in clinical trials - but experts have warned that first is not always the best.

item.title: Probation for two teens in drink sampling case at supermarket
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Two teenagers linked to a drink sampling incident at a supermarket amid the Covid-19 outbreak were each sentenced to probation yesterday.

item.title: Bar to hire foreigners raised, set even higher for finance sector
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

From Sept 1, firms applying for new Employment Passes (EPs) for foreign professionals will need to pay them a fixed monthly salary of at least $4,500, up from $3,900 now.

item.title: Sultan Mosque closed today for cleaning
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Sultan Mosque in Kampong Glam will be closed for disinfection today, after a visitor to the mosque on Aug 18 later tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Covid-19 an opportunity for change in transport sector
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

The Covid-19 pandemic has created an opportunity for Singapore to re-imagine its transport infrastructure, said Transport Minister Ong Ye Kung yesterday.

item.title: Delay to Punggol BTO project after contractor's services axed
item.description:
August 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Future home owners of a Build-To-Order (BTO) project in Punggol are facing a one-year delay after the Housing Board terminated the building contractor's services this month.

item.title: Sheng Siong outlet at Elias Mall, Our Tampines Hub among new places visited by infectious Covid-19 patients
item.description:
August 28, 2020 12:11 AM

There were 77 new coronavirus cases confirmed on Thursday, taking Singapore's total to 56,572.
